skill.name: triforce-sync-check
skill.description: Verify 3-Mirror skill sync consistency across .public/skills, .codex/skills, and .claude/skills. Use after skill changes, before commits, or for CI validation.
skill.summary: Verify 3-Mirror skill sync consistency across .public/skills, .codex/skills, and .claude/skills. Use...
skill.author: Doyajin174

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing verification procedures. No executable code, no network access, no file modifications. All operations are read-only filesystem checks using standard utilities.

content.value_statement: Skills may become inconsistent when copied across platforms. This skill validates that all skill files match between .public/skills, .codex/skills, and .claude/skills directories. Use before commits or in CI pipelines to catch drift early.
actual_capabilities: Verify skill count matches across all three directories
Check SKILL.md content hashes match exactly
Validate required YAML fields in each skill
limitations: Only validates content already present in directories
Requires skill directories to exist at expected paths
Manual intervention needed to fix inconsistencies

use_cases.title: CI Pipeline Validation
use_cases.description: Add to GitHub Actions workflows to block commits with desynchronized skills

use_cases.title: Pre-commit Verification
use_cases.description: Check skill consistency before pushing changes to ensure mirrors stay in sync

use_cases.title: Deployment Check
use_cases.description: Validate all skills are properly mirrored before production deployments

prompt_templates.title: Quick Count Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Count the skills in .public/skills, .codex/skills, and .claude/skills. Report whether all three counts match.

prompt_templates.title: Structure Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare the directory structure of .public/skills with .codex/skills and .claude/skills. List any missing or extra directories.

prompt_templates.title: Content Verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify that all SKILL.md files have matching content hashes across .public/skills, .codex/skills, and .claude/skills. Report any mismatches.

prompt_templates.title: Full Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a complete triforce sync check: verify counts match, structures match, content hashes match, YAML is valid, and no duplicate skill names exist. Provide a pass/fail summary.

output_examples.input: Run a complete triforce sync check on the skill directories
output: Count Check: PASS (15 skills in each directory)
YAML Validation: PASS (all skills have name and description)

best_practices: Run the sync check before every commit that modifies skills
Integrate into CI pipelines to catch drift automatically
Fix issues at the SSOT (.public/skills) first, then sync
anti_patterns: Manually editing mirrored directories instead of using sync
Skipping verification after bulk skill changes
Ignoring count mismatches without investigating the cause

faq.question: Which AI platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. These three platforms each have their own skills directory that should mirror the source.

faq.question: What are the sync limits?
faq.answer: The skill checks directories at fixed paths. Custom directory structures require modifying the verification commands manually.

faq.question: How do I integrate with CI/CD?
faq.answer: Add the verification commands to your workflow. The skill provides a GitHub Actions example that fails on any mismatch.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All operations are read-only. The skill only reads files and compares hashes without modifying anything.

faq.question: What if checks fail?
faq.answer: Identify which check failed, edit the source in .public/skills, then run node scripts/sync-skills.js to resynchronize mirrors.

faq.question: How is this different from manual diff?
faq.answer: This skill automates multiple checks including counts, hashes, YAML validation, and duplicate detection in a single operation.
